properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters from Cape Blanco OR to Pt. St. George CA out 10 nm; Waters from Cape Blanco OR to Pt. St. George CA from 10 to 60 nm
properties.headline: Gale Watch issued January 25 at 2:46AM PST until January 27 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Periods of southerly wind 25 to 35 knots are expected
this evening through Wednesday. A mix of southerly wind waves
and westerly swell will also keep seas steep and above 10 feet
through the forecast period. During the Hazardous Seas Warning
period seas will become very steep at 10 to 14 feet with a
dominant period of 10 seconds or less. Winds could increase to
35 to 40 knots with seas reaching 14 to 18 feet at 17 seconds
during the Gale Watch period.

* WHERE...All areas for the Small Craft Advisory and the Hazardous
Seas Warning. the Gale Watch is for areas between the coast and
25 NM from about Cape Ferrelo northward.

* WHEN... For the Small Craft Advisory, until 7 PM PST this
evening. For the Hazardous Seas Warning, from 7 PM this evening
to 4 AM PST Sunday. For the Small Craft Advisory, from 4 AM
Sunday to 10 AM PST Wednesday. For the Gale Watch, from Sunday
evening through Monday evening.

* IMPACTS...Steep seas will make conditions difficult to hazardous
for small craft. Increasing winds tonight into Sunday will
steepen seas to very steep. Strong winds and very steep seas
could capsize or damage vessels in the Gale Watch area during
the watch period. Low visibility conditions are expected at
times.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
A Small Craft Advisory means that winds and seas will create a
potential hazard to smaller vessels and inexperienced mariners.

A Hazardous Seas Warning means very steep and hazardous sea
conditions are imminent or occurring. Recreational boaters should
remain in port, or take shelter until waves subside.  Commercial
vessels should prepare for rough seas and consider remaining in
port or taking shelter in port until hazardous seas subside.

A Gale Watch is issued when the risk of gale force winds of 34 to
47 knots has significantly increased, but the specific timing
and/or location is still uncertain. It is intended to provide
additional lead time for mariners who may wish to consider
altering their plans.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...HAZARDOUS SEAS WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 AM PST SUNDAY... ...SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM SUNDAY TO 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... ...GALE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING
